bib.title: A large wordnet-based sentiment lexicon for Polish
bib.author: Za{\'s}ko-Zieli{\'n}ska, Monika and Piasecki, Maciej and Szpakowicz, Stan
bib.abstract: The applications of plWordNet, a very large wordnet for Polish, do not yet include work on sentiment and emotions. We present a pilot project to annotate plWordNet manually with sentiment polarity values and basic emotion values. We work with lexical units, plWordNet's basic building blocks. 1 So far, we have annotated about 30,000 nominal and adjectival LUs. The resulting lexicon is already one of the largest sentiment and emotion resources, in particular among those based on wordnets. We opted for manual annotation to ensure high
bib.booktitle: Proceedings of the International Conference Recent Advances in Natural Language Processing
